quote_first: “Well, they set sail, and after going ever so many thousand miles, or hundred - I forget which, but it doesn’t matter- a great storm arose, a typhoon or simoon, perhaps both; and after slowly gathering up its energies for the space of twenty-nine days, seven hours, and twenty-three minutes, without counting the seconds, it burst upon them at exactly
quote_last: , on the sixth day of the week.”
title: The Dodge Club; Or, Italy in MDCCCLIX
author: James De Mille
